item.title: Python Fundamentals
item.author: isaaczhou85@gmail.com (Isaac Zhou)
item.description: This post will cover the absolutely basics of Python language Types, Statements Unlike others, there’s no need to declare variables in Python ## No Need to declare Python variables answer = 42 name = "Python" print(answer) print(name) ## Integers and Floats can operate with each other answer = 42 pi = 3.14159 print(answer + pi) String We can use single, double and tripple quotes to create strings 'Hello World' == "Hello World" == """Hello World""" There are a number of useful string methods
